nodes.content: Let $m, n \geq 2$ be two integers. We denote by $G(n,m)$ the group defined by the presentation $\langle X, Y \ \vert \ X^m = Y^n \rangle$.
nodes.content_preview: Let m, n 2 be two integers. We denote by G(n,m) the group defined by the presentation X, Y X^m = Y^n .

nodes.content:
[{\cite[Section 2.2]{Gobet_toric}}]
Let $n,m\geq 2$ be coprime and $k \geq 2$. The \defn{toric reflection group} $W(k,n,m)$ is the quotient of $G(n,m)$ obtained by adding the relations $x_i^k = 1$ in Presentation~\ref{pres_2} for all $i=1, \dots, n$.
nodes.content_preview: [] Let n,m 2 be coprime and k 2. The W(k,n,m) is the quotient of G(n,m) obtained by adding the relations x_i^k = 1 in Presentation~ for all i=1, , n.

references.context: adding the relations $x_i^k = 1$ in Presentation~\ref{pres_2} for all $i=1, \dots, n$.

nodes.content: \label{2toric} Let $n,m$ be as above. A group of the form $W(2,n,m)$ will be called a \defn{$2$-toric reflection group}.
nodes.content_preview: Let n,m be as above. A group of the form W(2,n,m) will be called a .
